subject: HRTS
title: Discrimination, Rights, and Canadian Law
description: This course will introduce students to historical and contemporary discrimination disputes and controversies through an intersectional analysis of protected grounds of diversity such as gender, race, disability, and sexual orientation. Through this course, students will learn about the role that the Ontario Human Rights Code, the Ontario Human Rights Tribunal, and the Ontario Human Rights Commission play as mechanisms that enforce human rights. [Note: Formerly HRTS 102.]
